title: What did the Soldiers in the Vietnam War experience? - Quora
tags: Military History of the United States of America
History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Depended a lot on where you were and when. It was a long war. Those there initially were typically advisors or trainers to the South Vietnamese. In the late 1960s, the U.S. began adding combat units and the attendant support units. If you were in the latter, you were probably fixing things or carrying out administrative functions. If you were in the former, you might be on a fire base or carrying out search and destroy operations. Or you might be providing convoy security. Some units experienced intense combat, others not as much. It is difficult to generalize across unit types and time frames.
In my opinion, unless attached to special forces, you were fighting with young men who went to war kicking and screaming due the draft. Asked of the strangest thing seen, one could write a book!
